entry.summary: October 20, 2025 4:00 p.m. Personnel with the Roseburg Fire Department responded to a reported natural gas line rupture and a significant leak of natural gas in the 900 block of Southeast Pine Street on Monday. A release from RFP said crews were called out just after 8:00 a.m. Upon arrival, firefighters determined a 4-inch...

entry.title: Natural gas leak in Roseburg prompts evacuations and traffic detours
entry.summary: A natural gas line rupture on Southeast Pine Street prompted swift action by firefighters on Monday, according to the Roseburg Fire Department.

entry.title: Teen Released After Allegedly Bringing Gun to Yoncalla High School
entry.summary: An 18-year-old Yoncalla student was arrested after allegedly bringing a gun to school earlier this month. Taylor Haydon Larson was released on the condition he stay away from campus. He faces two weapons charges after a video showing a pistol in a school bathroom led to his arrest.

entry.title: MORNING CONVERSATION 10.20.25
entry.summary: Planning Committee member Jennifer Coalwell talks about Make a Difference Day -Douglas County which is happening this Saturday. She talks about how people can get signed up to help.

entry.title: Costumes and canines: Saving Grace Humane Society to hold Pints for Pits charity event
entry.summary: There are arguably few pets that are as divisive as pit bulls. While many find the breed to be lovable, loyal and sweet, others hold the view of them being aggressive and dangerous.

entry.title: Riddle Mayor Bill Duckett resigns after decades of service
entry.summary: RIDDLE — On Jan. 9, 1995, Bill Duckett officially became the mayor of Riddle. For the next 30 years, he helped spearhead projects and tackle issues that presented themselves for his community.

entry.title: The Roseburg Receiver Helps Bring New GMRS Repeater and Regional Safety Upgrades to Douglas County
entry.summary: The Roseburg Receiver is partnering with local radio operators to launch a new GMRS repeater on Mount Nebo, expanding emergency communication across Douglas County. This project will bring together repeaters across southern Oregon, keeping communities connected when other systems fail.

entry.title: Big Changes Ahead: Winston Shopping Center Set for Major Transformation
entry.summary: Winston’s main shopping center is getting a major upgrade. New owner Stipe Properties plans to invest over $1 million in improvements, including solar panels, new paint, flooring, and lighting. Sunrise Enterprises will stay, while new shops like a grocery store, bakery, and urgent care are planned.

entry.title: Arrest Made After Firearm Video Surfaces at Yoncalla High School
entry.summary: A student was arrested after a video on social media showed a firearm brought onto Yoncalla High School grounds. Authorities say there was no active threat, and Principal Chelsea Ross urged students to report safety concerns, calling communication critical. The investigation remains ongoing.

entry.title: UPDATE: Suspect Arrested in Fatal Winston-Area Hit-and-Run Crash
entry.summary: UPDATE: OSP arrested Brandon James Jensen, 41, in connection with a fatal hit-and-run that killed Dustin Rios, 30, on Highway 42 near Winston. Jensen faces charges of failure to perform the duties of a driver and tampering with evidence. The crash happened early Oct. 12, 2025.

entry.title: About the rise, burn and return of Rock Creek Hatchery

entry.title: FALL WEATHER BRINGS END TO FIRE SEASON FOR OREGON
entry.summary: October 17, 2025 11:00 a.m. As of Friday, all Oregon Department of Forestry districts have terminated fire restrictions, marking the end of the 2025 Oregon fire season declaration. entry.title: Living a natural life in the Umpqua
entry.summary: When a wildfire burns through an area, either rural or populated, it changes everything. After it destroys most things in its path, people, animals, plants and more are left to recover in their respective habitat.

entry.title: Cattle Dogs Golf Center to reopen as 24-hour facility, seeking new ownership
entry.summary: In January 2024, the Morin family opened Cattle Dogs Golf Center in Roseburg, bringing a new kind of activity to the area which catered to golf fanatics and newcomers alike: golf simulation.

entry.title: Candace Wene battles cancer for second time with more positive outlook
entry.summary: Candace Wene conquered breast cancer once already, going into remission after a battle in 2007.

entry.title: Following the stars: Roseburg-native astronomer named MacArthur Fellow
entry.summary: A Douglas County native who is an associate professor of astronomy at California Institute of Technology, or Caltech, recently received a large grant to continue his studies and work with black holes and stars.
